conclusion: Determine the mechanical energy loss during the perfectly inelastic collision between blocks C and B.
Block C slides on the skateboard with an initial velocity v_0 and travels a distance s_0.
Velocity of C relative to the ground will be v_0 until the collision.
In a perfectly inelastic collision, the two blocks stick together after the collision.
Their velocities become equal immediately after the collision.
Define v_f as the common velocity of blocks C and B after the collision.
Define v_0 as the initial velocity of block C and m as the mass of each block.
Momentum conservation equation: m v_0 = 2m v_f, leading to v_f = v_0/2.
Kinetic energy of block C before the collision is K_i = 1/2 m v_0^2.
After the collision, kinetic energy of combined mass is K_f = 1/4 m v_0^2.
Mechanical energy loss is Î”E = K_i - K_f = 1/4 m v_0^2.
Mechanical energy loss during the collision between C and B is 1/4 m v_0^2.
